programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys haggle over a First World War helmet and a holster from the TV series Gunsmoke, while Rick decides they need to get into shape.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team members get their hands on an 1863 rifle that proved decisive in the American Civil War, and examine a fully restored 1915 Ford Model T taxi.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Baseball stars Tommy Lasorda, Ron Cey and Paul Lo Duca challenge Rick to transform a 1950s drinks cooler into a hot dog cart.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick challenges a potential new recruit to prove his worth by restoring a scooter.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: The rescue team struggles when a trailer carrying wood overturns on the carriageway. Later, a lorry transporting fine wine ends up at the bottom of a ravine.

programme.title: Shipping Wars
programme.sub-title: Planes, Pains and a Spire of Flames
programme.desc: Jennifer hauls a light aircraft in one of the toughest jobs of her career, while Marc faces serious consequences if he does not make his deadline.

programme.title: Shipping Wars
programme.desc: Jarrett Joyce transports a DeLorean car to a demanding buyer, while Roy Garber's hauling business is brought to a standstill in Texas when his truck breaks down.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: When a gun advocate is murdered in her own home, detectives use forensic evidence to prove that the person they suspect is responsible.

programme.title: Parking Wars
programme.desc: Sonja has to confront irate drivers after Rodney and Courtney clamp their cars.

programme.title: Parking Wars
programme.desc: An exotic dancer calls on two former lovers to free her car from the Philadelphia impound lot.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds have a decision to make when a man wants to buy a pair of very expensive earrings on the condition that the store also does his piercing.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Former employee Tressa returns to sell the Rolex that got her sacked and Les struggles to control the situation when insults start to fly between her and Ashley.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike is impressed by a vintage caravan and a strange totem pole when he and Frank examine a veteran collector's hoard.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: Stories of UFO sightings and alien abductions, beginning with reports of multiple bright aerial lights near Tinley Park, Illinois, in 2004.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Baseball stars Tommy Lasorda, Ron Cey and Paul Lo Duca challenge Rick to transform a 1950s drinks cooler into a hot dog cart.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick challenges a potential new recruit to prove his worth by restoring a scooter.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys race to check out a motorbike once owned by The Great Escape actor Steve McQueen. They also encounter a rare shotgun disguised as a cane.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys value a first-edition copy of an Ernest Hemingway novel and a 1932 Lincoln Roadster, and discover the story behind an unusual belt-buckle.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy knows exactly what he wants at an auction in Fontana and has high hopes of getting it, while Jarrod and Brandi need to work on their tactics.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Thrill of a Kitty and the Agony of Smoked Meat
programme.desc: Darrell aims to prove that treasure sometimes looks like total trash, while Rene won't be content with second best.

programme.desc: The Golds have a decision to make when a man wants to buy a pair of very expensive earrings on the condition that the store also does his piercing.

programme.desc: Former employee Tressa returns to sell the Rolex that got her sacked and Les struggles to control the situation when insults start to fly between her and Ashley.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four bladesmiths have to work without any electricity in a gruelling qualifier, before the two finalists must forge the legendary Scottish Claymore.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Experts join the trail of purported Nazi time travel device, Die Glocke, to try and find out if it really did exist and if it could it have been based on alien technology.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The team examines new evidence relating to strange noises and orange lights that caused alarm in Indiana in 2008, and considers theories that say it was a military jet.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The retailers scrutinise a signature apparently made by deposed Iraqi leader Saddam Hussein, and Les loses his cool with a customer over a broken necklace. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les goes on the rampage when he finds out a thief has been on the premises, and a customer selling a guitar signed by Kid Rock reveals a valuable secret.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to West Covina in California, where Jarrod and Brandi bring in an expert to sniff out the best lockers and Darrell and Brandon help everyone dress for success.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Mary faces stiff opposition as she tries to turn a bad day around with a great locker, as everyone is out to make big bucks at auctions in Riverside.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: North v South
programme.desc: The animosity between southern and northern boats reaches fever pitch, while the long-standing rivalry between two other boats raises the stakes.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate stories of a French church that supposedly contains a gateway to another universe and an alien library believed to be hidden underneath the Great Sphinx of Giza.

programme.title: Search for the Lost Giants
programme.desc: Brothers Jim and Bill Vieira investigate accounts of giant skeletons being found across America, to determine if these stories are true and who the bones belonged to.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy knows exactly what he wants at an auction in Fontana and has high hopes of getting it, while Jarrod and Brandi need to work on their tactics.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Thrill of a Kitty and the Agony of Smoked Meat
programme.desc: Darrell aims to prove that treasure sometimes looks like total trash, while Rene won't be content with second best.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner welcomes Strictly Come Dancing head judge Len Goodman, actress and impressionist Ronni Ancona and quick-witted comic Tim Vine to discuss their pet hates, in the hope of having them banished to Room 101. Their gripes include cats in the garden, karaoke DJs, foreign food and small talk at parties.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Grumpy comic Jack Dee, footballer-turned-presenter Gary Lineker and actress Fay Ripley reveal their pet hates to Frank Skinner in the hope he will banish them to Room 101. Things that really get on the guests' nerves this week include white-van drivers, competitive parents and people who tell the truth.

programme.title: Insert Name Here
programme.desc: Historian Kate Williams and comedians Lucy Porter, Chris Addison and Al Porter join host Sue Perkins and captains Richard Osman and Josh Widdicombe on the comedy panel show. In this edition, the two sides answer questions about famous people past and present who share the name Steve, with the winners earning the right to pick the greatest bearer of the moniker - prompting comic banter, funny facts and unusual stats as the teams vie to outdo each other.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Nish Kumar, Luisa Omielan, David O'Doherty
programme.desc: Last week saw the return of the comedy show in which three comedians take the stage of the Hammersmith Apollo in west London. The premise is simple. One comic acts as host, warming up the audience before introducing short sets by two other stand-ups. Future editions promise the likes of Ed Byrne, Rob Beckett, Joel Dommett, Henning Wehn, Lucy Porter, but tonight Nish Kumar plays host, before handing over to David O'Doherty and Luisa Omielan.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Rose Matafeo, Rachel Parris, Romesh Ranganathan and Jon Richardson are posed increasingly absurd hypothetical situations. Presented by Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim and Gendle are inspired by a game of Top Golf, though they replace balls with bikes, and take the action to a lake littered with targets.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Two males on bikes are spotted acting suspiciously near a cashpoint. One evades police and a pursuit ensues. A police dog undertakes its final shift.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike makes a mistake in Indiana, and while the guys get a warm reception from a carnie collector in Ohio, the pick brings an unexpected sting.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Lori goes behind Brandon's back as she teams up with Jesse, while Papa Bear thinks there might be a shotgun hidden in one lot.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori head to an airport storage and luggage auction to bid for the cast-offs of the rich and famous.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys visit a man who has not thrown away anything since the 1950s, and is not willing to start now. And he also has a penchant for swimming trunks.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike, Frank, Robbie and Danielle all hit the road in search of treasure, to see what the jam-packed yards and barns of Virginia have in store for them.

programme.title: Last Stop Garage
programme.desc: Collin and Corey are hired to transform a client's bruised up Crown Victoria Interceptor into a rough and ready rat rod, stripping it down to a rolling chassis.

programme.title: Last Stop Garage
programme.desc: To attract tourists to North West River and make a friend's culinary dreams come true, the boys build a gourmet food boat complete with kitchen, barbecue and seating for six.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson gets behind the wheel of a Reliant Robin to investigate the reasons behind the lack of three-wheeled cars on the market. The Stig takes the Bentley Continental Supersports for a spin around the test track, and James May fires up the Toyota Hilux for a final challenge - a gruelling drive up Eyjafjallajokull, an active Icelandic volcano that halted flights in British airspace in 2010

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Documentary series following the work of the Staffordshire Police force. Rookie cop Ash is in the thick of it during a late night brawl in Stoke-on-Trent.

programme.title: Last Stop Garage
programme.desc: The local Search & Rescue squad needs a fast craft that can navigate the shallow water that surrounds North West River, so Collin and Corey come up with a unique solution.

programme.title: Last Stop Garage
programme.desc: An old buddy of Collin and Corey's wants to turn his spare sled into a 'Water Skipper' that can skim across the lake in summer. The boys make special mods to lighten the snowmobile.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: The team sets out to design and build an all seeing 360 degree camera car. A frontline X5 with a serious mechanical failure is needed urgently back out on the front line, and the cops encounter a cuddly criminal and a hungry speed-demon.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters search for the world's best four-seat supercar, pitting the Aston Martin Rapide against the Porsche Panamera Turbo and Maserati Quattroporte in a series of unusual challenges in the south of England. Harry Potter star Rupert Grint and ex-Formula One driver Rubens Barrichello each do a lap in the Reasonably Priced Car and Richard Hammond puts the Chevrolet Camaro SS and Mercedes E63 AMG through their paces on the test track.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The three hosts are each given a budget of Â£5,000 to find a car that can hold its own on a racetrack and handle everyday tasks, before testing their purchases in Germany. James May puts two Porsches through their paces on the Top Gear test circuit, and former Downing Street communications director Alastair Campbell tries out the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner welcomes Strictly Come Dancing head judge Len Goodman, actress and impressionist Ronni Ancona and quick-witted comic Tim Vine to discuss their pet hates, in the hope of having them banished to Room 101. Their gripes include cats in the garden, karaoke DJs, foreign food and small talk at parties.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Grumpy comic Jack Dee, footballer-turned-presenter Gary Lineker and actress Fay Ripley reveal their pet hates to Frank Skinner in the hope he will banish them to Room 101. Things that really get on the guests' nerves this week include white-van drivers, competitive parents and people who tell the truth.

programme.title: Insert Name Here
programme.desc: Comedians Nish Kumar and Katherine Ryan, historian Kate Williams and sports presenter Gabby Logan join host Sue Perkins and captains Richard Osman and Josh Widdicombe as the comedy quiz returns. The two teams answer questions about famous people who share a name, with the winning trio getting to decide the greatest-ever bearer of this week's moniker.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Rob Beckett, Jen Brister, Darren Harriott
programme.desc: Stand-up comedian Rob Beckett plays host in this show recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo. He warms up the audience and then introduces routines by rising comedy stars Jen Brister and Darren Harriott.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Rose Matafeo, Rachel Parris, Romesh Ranganathan and Jon Richardson are posed increasingly absurd hypothetical situations. Presented by Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Terms and Conditions Apply
programme.desc: Using his trademark, powerpoint-comedy and mischievous games, Dave invites Rose Matafeo, Phil Wang and Marcus Brigstocke to help him make sense of our insensible world.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright expands his empire by opening a mobile shop in a bid to impress Nurse Gladys Emmanuel, but the enterprise is cut short by a close encounter with some perishables.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright loses his trousers on the way to the wedding of Nurse Gladys Emmanuel's niece, and ends up having to borrow a pair of her trousers to wear at the event.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: The story of the Ahnenerbe research institute, which was set up to provide scientific backing to Hitler's ideology, through a series of horrific experiments.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on an expedition along Dorset's Jurassic coast to explore the county's hidden Second World War story. Starting beside the defences on Chesil Beach, he heads east to finish in Swanage and Studland Bay. On his five-day walk he encounters stunning scenery and uncovers wartime acts of ingenuity and bravery. He also discovers the crucial part a swannery played in developing a secret weapon and reveals the role of Dorset in protecting Britain from invasion during the conflict.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey describes how Winston Churchill drew on the lessons of his ancestor John to lead the UK through the Second World War. At two key moments, the prime minister's strategic sense helped avert disaster, and in both decisions, the influence of the Duke of Marlborough is apparent. Starkey argues that it was Winston's ability to control events by giving them a narrative meaning that enabled him to shape world history long after his fall from power.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson sets off on a 45-mile hike through the countryside of the Weald in Kent and the Downs of East Sussex to discover the area's rich and surprising Tudor heritage. At Penshurst Place, author Philippa Gregory helps him relish the fate of the Grand Duke of Buckingham at the hands of the young Henry VIII. From there, he travels up what used to be secret paths to Hever Castle and finds out how the monarch's reign brought not only huge social, political and industrial change, but also fame and disaster to the women who caught his eye He ends this leg of his journey in Lewes, where he relives one of the more brutal monastic dissolutions.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: In a special 20th anniversary celebration for the programme, Tony Robinson relives the best bits from more than 200 episodes, taking in major highlights such as digging up the garden of Buckingham Palace to reveal a crashed Spitfire and discovering the first stone circle to be found in Britain for 150 years. There is a reminder of how the show grew from nervous beginnings in a Somerset field into attempting city-wide digs and promoting nationwide events in which thousands of people spent the weekend digging in their own backyards.

programme.title: Time Team Specials
programme.sub-title: War of the Roses: A Time Team Special
programme.desc: Tony Robinson heads to Leicestershire to examine archaeological discoveries at the site of the Battle of Bosworth Field, a confrontation that took place in 1485 and led to Henry Tudor taking the English Crown. Artefacts are unearthed that challenge the traditional interpretation of events, and Tony hears from experts who believe that not only were gunpowder weapons used in far greater numbers than previously thought, but also that the encounter was fought in a different place.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: The establishment of the concentration camps, revealing how quickly a system of concentration populations turned into a tool for mass murder.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: The search for looted gold hidden by the Nazis in North Africa. Plus, how the Russian army used dogs as a secret weapon and a mysterious message just before the Pearl Harbor attack.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A formerly luxurious and strategic mountain-top villa on the island of Rhodes in the Mediterranean that's been ravaged by acts of revenge by locals since 1955.

programme.title: Time Team Specials
programme.sub-title: War of the Roses: A Time Team Special
programme.desc: Tony Robinson heads to Leicestershire to examine archaeological discoveries at the site of the Battle of Bosworth Field, a confrontation that took place in 1485 and led to Henry Tudor taking the English Crown. Artefacts are unearthed that challenge the traditional interpretation of events, and Tony hears from experts who believe that not only were gunpowder weapons used in far greater numbers than previously thought, but also that the encounter was fought in a different place.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough takes a look at animals that rely on other species, from cuckoos planting their eggs in other birds' nests to the death's-head hawkmoth stealing honey.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough takes a look at gorillas and vampire bats, two species that have unfairly gained unpleasant reputation within the animal kingdom.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Felicity Aston and Dr Kevin Fong finally arrive at the end of their gruelling journey in Dawson City. They set up a traditional mining camp in the heart of the gold fields, before facing their next challenge. They have just five days to find gold in an area that has already been heavily mined, and can only use the back-breaking methods of the 19th-century early pioneers.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A formerly luxurious and strategic mountain-top villa on the island of Rhodes in the Mediterranean that's been ravaged by acts of revenge by locals since 1955.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: The search for looted gold hidden by the Nazis in North Africa. Plus, how the Russian army used dogs as a secret weapon and a mysterious message just before the Pearl Harbor attack.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: The establishment of the concentration camps, revealing how quickly a system of concentration populations turned into a tool for mass murder.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A strange-looking town with a supernatural atmosphere, a collection of imposing buildings in southern Australia, and the remains of curious-looking basins emerging from the waves.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: Exploring the military headquarters built beneath Dover Castle during the Second World War and Odessa's catacombs, possibly the largest tunnel network in the world.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright is reluctant to buy a new suit until Nurse Gladys Emmanuel persuades him to. He agrees, but only if I can be made in the same style as his old one. Roy Clarke's classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, David Jason and Lynda Baron.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright expands his empire by opening a mobile shop in a bid to impress Nurse Gladys Emmanuel, but the enterprise is cut short by a close encounter with some perishables.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright loses his trousers on the way to the wedding of Nurse Gladys Emmanuel's niece, and ends up having to borrow a pair of her trousers to wear at the event.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A vast project in the icy wilderness of southern Alaska, and a landscape of confusing and surprising structures that represented a bold statement of Spain's plans for the future.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Nikki is furious with Leo when he re-examines a child abuse case by her former mentor, leading to conflict between the pathologists. But she soon has more to worry about when a workman at the centre reveals how his mother is being manipulated by a convicted serial killer into searching for his hidden teenage victims.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Beatrice contemplates expanding the business, while an unexpected offer from one of Jack's old flames has bittersweet consequences. Starring Stella Gonet.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Tired of being undermined by Florence, Tilly resigns as head seamstress. Meanwhile, Evie spends a weekend working for the wealthy Duglass family - but finds herself caught in the middle of a feud. Period drama, starring Stella Gonet and Louise Lombard.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Tensions rise as the two sisters disagree over the final designs for their fashion collection, and when Evie decides to move out, both their careers and relationships are threatened. Period drama, starring Stella Gonet and Louise Lombard.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Shauna admits to having an affair with Mooney, Sally gets an unexpected visitor and George finally comes clean about his failing eyesight.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The team takes action when a block of flats catches fire. Meanwhile, an old flame causes trouble for George. Starring Anthony Green and Glen Murphy.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Tom tries to work his way back up the career ladder by landing the post of consultant, while Kath also hopes to secure a new job as clinical matron, but doesn't realise Chrissie has applied for the same position. Ed decides to postpone his exams, unable to concentrate because of his growing concern for his father, and Lisa feels she is no longer one of the girls after being forced to reproach Jess and Donna, although a drink with Owen soon cheers her up. Former Coronation Street actor Chris Bisson guest stars.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Already haunted by Kerry's rape, Cameron is plunged into further emotional torment after failing to save the two drowning children. Sam's hunt for the Sun Hill rapist is jeopardised by a witness's suicide attempt and alarm bells ring for Ken when he spies the matriarch of a notorious criminal clan thought to have been in exile abroad. Guest starring Lynda Bellingham.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Recovering alcoholic Jim finds himself battling an addiction of a different sort as he gets bitten by the gambling bug, and there's a big surprise in store for Phil.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ethel and Jules team up to get rid of Nick, while Eddie excitedly makes plans for changes to the Queen Vic.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Dot is sure that Nick is deceiving her - but for once he may prove her wrong.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A distressed Salvation Army officer crashes his car while smitten by a childhood sweetheart who has re-entered his life, while money-lenders attack the son of a woman in their debt. A cross-dresser is admitted in women's clothes after falling down a flight of stairs, requiring the staff to remain tactful when his wife pays a visit.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.sub-title: The Black Virgin of Vladimir - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. An American acquaintance of Lovejoy's is sold some fake antiques, so he sets out to exact revenge on the dealer responsible - and make a little money into the bargain. Linda Gray and Brian Blessed guest star, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: A civil servant is exposed as a spy and, while fleeing to Russia, she stops off in Jersey - unaware her Soviet contact, the man she is also in love with, has been ordered to kill her.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Shifty slinks back home to Grandad's. As Billy's ex-wife moves away, the lovely Leonora moves in to her old house.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Mr Grace decides to move with the times by making an advertisement to be shown in local cinemas. Classic comedy, starring John Inman and the late Mollie Sugden.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth disappoints Richard by buying him a pair of skis for his birthday, intending to strap them to the car in yet another attempt to impress the neighbours. However, the scheme backfires when her rich sister Violet arrives and cuts her down to size.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Truly and Clegg are enlightened in the wisdom of the East by an electrical handyman from Hull, and Howard struggles to keep his self-styled bandit persona alive. Meanwhile, a debt-collector is an unwelcome guest for Tom.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: A couple attempt to sue their council after developing medical conditions they claim were caused by a local mobile phone mast used to transmit internal police communications. Meanwhile, Deed is approached by the wife of a former Iraqi minister who says her family were poisoned and killed by depleted uranium used in the British Army's shells.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The body of a missing computer expert turns up in a hospital morgue under a false name, so the team reopens the investigation into his disappearance. The dead man worked for the Metropolitan Police, giving him access to a great deal of sensitive information - added to which, he was in contact with a group of online hackers. But he died of natural causes - so why was his body hidden, and by who? As the seasoned detectives unravel the mystery, Brian struggles to accept Steve as the new Ucos member, forcing Esther to intervene. Guest starring Sarah Smart and Alex Jennings.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Harry is disturbed to be called to a crime scene at the home of a family he knows, and finds the bodies of the mother and her teenage daughter, while her stepson lies in a coma - although her toddler has been left unharmed. The police suspect the woman's husband to be the killer, but the pathologist is not so sure of his guilt.

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: The host is joined in the studio by comedian, author and Britain's Got Talent judge David Walliams and Edward Norton, who has recently directed his second movie, crime drama Motherless Brooklyn. Also dropping in are the stars of the new Charlie's Angels movie, Kristen Stewart, Naomi Scott and Ella Balinska, and Robbie Williams, who will be performing live.

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: After a mystery sea monster washes up on a UK beach, extreme angler Jeremy Wade sets off on a journey to unmask this beast and find out whether it poses any threat to humans. His journey takes him to London, where he digs for clues among celebrated naturalist Charles Darwin's historic specimens, to the frozen waters of Greenland, where he ice fishes deeper than he's ever fished before, and on to the fjords of Norway, where he attempts to reel in one of these sea monsters before an Arctic storm rolls in.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder

programme.title: Good Morning Britain

programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal

programme.title: The Switch
programme.desc: Quiz in which players can accumulate big cash totals by answering super quick-fire easy money questions. However, in order to take home that cash, they must survive The Switch, a series of three super hard multiple-choice questions that each has only one incorrect choice. Hosted by Sanjeev Bhaskar.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Cash Trapped
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Bradley Walsh in which six contestants battle it out across a series of fast-paced question rounds where the players must actively try to sabotage their opponents by beating them to the buzzer and trapping them out of the game. In the final round, the person who has earned the most cash will go head to head against the rest of the group to try to take their winnings home.

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Bernice asks Leanna for help, Billy's furious with Al, and Andrea dreads the truth coming out.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Fiz apologises for keeping secrets from Tyrone, and Roy faces opposition from Richard's daughter, Nina. Meanwhile, Paul receives counselling for his abuse.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: The comedian follows the work of Battersea Dogs & Cats Home in London, meeting staff involved in treating, training and rehoming animals. In the sixth episode, the comedian meets an albino Pekingese riddled with health problems, and in need of an operation on his eye, which is making it difficult for him to find a new home. Meanwhile, a dog rescued from a near death experience in the Thames needs help overcoming his nerves, and a Labrador puppy arrives with a mystery illness affecting his lungs.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Jade expresses concerns about Fiz's parenting, and Roy and Nina clash over Richard's care. Elsewhere, Sarah suggests an alternative business model for Underworld.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How the price of bread is set, the production of speedy lawnmowers, and how coconuts are employed to clean water.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer searches for a Volvo P1800 - but owing to a lack of available specimens, has trouble finding one that fits into his price range.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini takes a Chrysler CG Imperial LeBaron Dual Cowl Phaeton to Kuwait's Concours d'Elegance.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini enthuses about a 1931 Ford Model A Starlite coupe hot rod that won the Autoram as it goes under auction without a reserve.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: A comedic compilation of some of the most daring drivers who take speed to the next levels. Featuring unusual pedestrians and a party on wheels like no other.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Real-life footage of road-based disasters, including hair-raising near misses, high-octane police chases and disastrous car accidents.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A chain reaction of explosions is triggered by a grenade, a aeroplane crashes at a baseball match and a house is lifted off its foundations in a backdraft explosion.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: An F-18 fighter jet crash lands, a car becomes airborne before crashing at 230mph, a skier narrowly survives a 100ft jump and the crew of a cargo ship is rescued.

programme.title: Heli-Loggers
programme.desc: Gord Closson is forced to intervene when environmental problems caused by another logging company threaten to contaminate the water supply of a nearby town.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: Chip Foose and a team of mechanics repair and revamp an old VW Microbus.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The construction and maintenance of the Mississippi River's famous steam-powered paddleboats, and the creation of the powerful 'waterfall' defence system.

programme.title: Codes and Conspiracies
programme.desc: Looking at America's founding fathers, including which one used sex as an instrument of diplomacy, and which secretly scoffed at the divinity of Jesus.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Around 1,500 fishermen descend on Dutch Harbour for the first day of the Alaskan king crab season, which can secure them a full year's pay in just one week.

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: Torrential rain threatens to drown out the season for the Dirt Dogs. Remote prospectors Henri and Kellie hit a hot streak, while the Gold Gypsies strike a once-in-a- lifetime find.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Arid conditions promise a rough ride for Steve as he travels from Perth into central Australia. Mick has a punishing climb over the Great Dividing Range.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer is on the lookout for a two-seat roadster with attitude in the form of an original BMW Z1, which could make a tidy profit after Edd China works his magic.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini sells classic Italian sports cars, including a 1971 Ferrari Daytona Spyder, at an auction.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.sub-title: Amelia Island: Get Some, Give Some
programme.desc: Wayne Carini auctions off a 1949 Mercury Woodie wagon and a rare 1961 Austin-Healey 3000 Mk I BN7, for a client.

programme.title: Codes and Conspiracies
programme.desc: Looking at the various cults in the US, from religious fire-and-brimstone and Armageddon, to visitors from outer space.

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: The Dirt Dogs' comeback rests on a crucial make-or-break action. Chris and Greg surf a wave of reef gold, and Henri and Kellie risk life and limb to continue working a rich vein.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The fishermen come to the end of a long night spent baiting and setting up crab pots in extreme weather conditions and anxiously await the captain's signal to start hauling them in. Meanwhile, the crew on one of the boats realise they could fall behind when the boards in its storage bin break.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: The self-proclaimed 'best dredger in Nome' quits the fleet, and Shawn takes his daughter to work - but he soon has his hands full with a hydraulic leak.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard embarks on a road trip, travelling to Norfolk, Pembroke and Essex. In Pembroke, he finds an old church that has been converted into an antiques store with a varied selection.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Documentary following drivers along some of the toughest roads in Australia. Steve Grahame hauls $3million worth of equipment to an isolated community.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer searches for a Volvo P1800 - but owing to a lack of available specimens, has trouble finding one that fits into his price range.

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: Kellie and Henri face poachers and a crippling dry streak, and the âDirt Dogs' must break new ground to stay in business. Plus, the âGold Gypsies' seek out precious reef gold.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard is on a mission for quality, heading to a decorative antiques dealer in Royal Tunbridge Wells, Kent. In Dumfries, he seeks hidden treasure in a furniture collection.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters - Best Buys
programme.desc: Salvage hunter Drew Pritchard looks back at some of the most memorable finds and interesting characters he's encountered while hunting for items for his shop in Conwy.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Bitesize
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard gets into a bidding war in a renowned Hampshire auction house. Then, in Lancashire, he finds a unique piece of art.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: A round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The Atlanta Prison riots of November 1987, which broke out when the US struck a deal with Cuba to repatriate up to 2,500 refugees held at the facility. The uprising lasted 11 days, involved more than 100 hostages, and saw a substantial portion of the prison destroyed by fire.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Photographic evidence captured by forensic experts who are the first to the scene of a crime.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The hunt for 18-year-old Kelsey Smith, who disappeared from a Kansas Mall in June 2007. The only clue detectives had was the haunting final images of her on surveillance video. The case turned into a murder investigation when Kelsey's body was recovered from a lake in Missouri a month later.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The fatal shooting of the sheriff of Cleveland, Oklahoma. Law enforcement determined to find justice for their fellow officer.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The case of a girl who was abducted while camping with her family, examining the phone call on the anniversary of her disappearance that led to the culprit's conviction.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: The team helps a dog suffering from heatstroke and rescues another that has become entangled in a fence.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown and his team treat more creatures from the Cook Islands, including a cat that is missing part of its nose and a massive five-metre crocodile.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Samantha wants a dress that shows off her tattoo, but her mother is not impressed. Meanwhile, singer Vanessa needs a 1930s-style dress for her jazz-inspired wedding.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Former pageant consultant and part-time model Ashely dreams of a gown she tried on at a different salon.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Unsure of any of her wedding details, Whitney comes to the store looking for a dress with no style or budget in mind. Plus, a bride and her sister have difficulty agreeing on a dress.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown helps a cuckoo with an injured leg, rescues two dogs from a rooftop, examines a golden retriever, and checks a koala's eyesight.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown treats a racehorse to see if it can join the unwanted thoroughbred programme. Plus, a dog hit by a car, and a kitten with earache receive attention.

programme.title: Animal Cops Miami
programme.desc: Officers are called to rescue a black bear that has been hit by a car, while investigators confront the owner of an illegal pig-slaughtering operation.

programme.title: Animal Cops Miami
programme.desc: Investigators try to trace a man caught on CCTV beating a cat, two neglected dogs are found just in time, and owls are rescued from a demolition site.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore visits a recycling centre in Walsall, West Midlands, grabbing three items she hopes to transform, sell on and send off to new homes. Reclamation duo the Junk Gypsies are tasked with turning a pair of teak legs into something stunning, while furniture experts the Three Restorers take on a broken desk. The trio of eclectic tip-finds is rounded off with the item Sarah will work on herself - a formica kitchen table and three chairs. Narrated by Arthur Smith.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How murder investigation experts reconstruct crimes from the remains of burnt evidence when the body of the victim has yet to be identified.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 38-year-old Eric Franks, who vanished while preparing to move house with his long-lost high school girlfriend and the daughter they had together. However, he failed to called his mother after March 2011, leaving police struggling for answers as to his whereabouts.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 19-year-old Katelin Akens, who vanished in a Virginia shopping mall, while en route to the airport to fly home to her fiancee.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Social media superstar Claudia Oshry hits Kleinfeld with her opinionated sisters, and Baton Rouge bride Kelli Hutchinson gets the surprise of a lifetime.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bodybuilder wants a dress that makes her look big, and a bride plots an elaborate wedding at the Grand Canyon.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Helena wants her eight bridesmaids to wear a different vintage dress as Lori tries to prevent the bride's vision from looking like chaos.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride wants short and revealing dresses for her bridesmaids but must convince her religious mother and sister. Plus, another bride struggles to make a decision without her mother.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: A bride who has never worn a dress before wants Jo and Al to find her something sparkly, but feels nervous wearing it.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: A bride who has recently gained weight worries she will not fit into her dress, and only has four weeks before the big day.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard discovers treasures in an Oxfordshire brewery, and drives a hard bargain with a fairground fanatic in Essex.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms three items from the Witley Recycling Centre in Surrey, including a collection of fishing rods, and a reproduction designer chair.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. Maja moved to Houston to undertake a difficult weight-loss journey with the support of her boyfriend, Christian. However, when he abruptly left her, she discovered that the only person she could count on was herself.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.desc: Chris Jacobs unwraps the mystery of a woman's origins, which began with her abandonment at a Korean orphanage. Lisa Joyner helps a woman forced to place her baby for adoption.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.sub-title: Tumour Bigger Than My Head: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: The stories of a boy with a tumour on his skull that is larger than his head and a family seeking to adopt a five-year-old boy with no nose.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The hunt for a killer who preyed on senior citizens in the town of River Parish, Louisiana, during the spring of 1997.
